member.name: T:OpenAiTTS.Monotic.Multimedia.MP3.MP3Info
member.summary: Provides methods to retrieve informations about MPEG files and to get and set different tag formats.

remarks.para:
Use the MP3Info class for typical operations on MPEG files, like reading and writing ID3 v1 and v2 tags or getting general MPEG informations.
In members that accept a path as an input string, that path must be well-formed or an exception is raised. For example, if a path is fully qualified but begins with a space, the path is not trimmed in methods of the class. Therefore, the path is malformed and an exception is raised. Similarly, a path or a combination of paths cannot be fully qualified twice. For example, "c:\temp c:\windows" also raises an exception in most cases. Ensure that your paths are well-formed when using methods that accept a path string.

This class was made by using informations from the following websites:
http://gabriel.mp3-tech.org/mp3infotag.html
http://www.multiweb.cz/twoinches/MP3inside.htm#MP3FileStructure
http://www.codeguru.com/vb/gen/vb_multimedia/mp3s/article.php/c4267
http://www.getid3.org/
http://www.mp3-converter.com/mp3codec/mp3_anatomy.htm
http://www.mp3-tech.org/
http://www.codeproject.com/audio/MPEGAudioInfo.asp

member.example:
The following example demonstrates some of the main members of the MP3Info class.
[Visual Basic] Dim objInfo As New MP3Info("c:\test.mp3") ...

member.summary: Gets or sets the filename of the MP3 file.

value.para: The filename of the MP3 file.

member.exception: The specified file is not a valid MP3 file.

member.summary: Gets the total file size in size.

value.para: File size in bytes.

member.name: P:OpenAiTTS.Monotic.Multimedia.MP3.MP3Info.HeaderPosition
member.summary: Gets the position of the MPEG header.

value.para: The position of the MPEG header.

member.name: P:OpenAiTTS.Monotic.Multimedia.MP3.MP3Info.ID3v1Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets the ID3v1 tag.

value.para: An ID3v1Tag object containing the ID3v1 tag.

member.name: P:OpenAiTTS.Monotic.Multimedia.MP3.MP3Info.VBRScale
member.summary: Gets the encoding quality for variable bitrate encoded files.

value.para: An integer describing the quality of the encoding.

member.remarks: The range of these value starts with "0" (best) and ends with "100" (worst). The property will return "-1" if the file was encoded using a constant bitrate.

value.para: An EncodingEnum value describing the encoding.

member.name: P:OpenAiTTS.Monotic.Multimedia.MP3.MP3Info.FrameSize
member.summary: Gets the size of each frame of the audio data in bytes.

value.para: The size of each frame of the audio data in bytes.

member.remarks: If the file is encoded with a variable bitrate, this value describes the average frame size.

member.name: P:OpenAiTTS.Monotic.Multimedia.MP3.MP3Info.FrameSamples
member.summary: Gets the number of samples for each audio frame.

value.para: The number of samples for each audio frame.

member.name: P:OpenAiTTS.Monotic.Multimedia.MP3.MP3Info.MPEGVersion

value.para: A MPEGTypeEnum value describing the MPEG audio type.

member.remarks: MPEG Version 2.5 was added lately to the MPEG 2 standard. It is an extension used for very low bitrate files, allowing the use of lower sampling frequencies. If your decoder does not support this extension, it is recommended for you to use 12 bits for synchronization instead of 11 bits.

value.para: A LayerEnum value describing the MPEG layer.

member.name: P:OpenAiTTS.Monotic.Multimedia.MP3.MP3Info.Protection

value.para: A ProtectionEnum value describing the protection.

member.remarks: If this property returns CRC, the file is protected by CRC (16bit CRC follows header).

member.name: P:OpenAiTTS.Monotic.Multimedia.MP3.MP3Info.ChannelMode

value.para: A ChannelModeEnum value describing the channel mode.

member.remarks:
Dual channel files are made of two independant mono channel. Each one uses exactly half the bitrate of the file. Most decoders output them as stereo, but it might not always be the case.
One example of use would be some speech in two different languages carried in the same bitstream, and then an appropriate decoder would decode only the choosen language.

member.name: P:OpenAiTTS.Monotic.Multimedia.MP3.MP3Info.SamplingRateFrequency
member.summary: Gets the sampling rate frequency in Hz.

value.para: An integer containing the sampling rate frequency in Hz.

member.name: P:OpenAiTTS.Monotic.Multimedia.MP3.MP3Info.Copyright

value.para: A boolean value containing the copyright.

member.remarks: The copyright has the same meaning as the copyright bit on CDs and DAT tapes, i.e. telling that it is illegal to copy the contents if the bit is set.

member.name: P:OpenAiTTS.Monotic.Multimedia.MP3.MP3Info.Bitrate

value.para: The bitrate in kbps.

member.remarks:
The return value "0" means free format. The free bitrate must remain constant, an must be lower than the maximum allowed bitrate. Decoders are not required to support decoding of free bitrate streams.
The return value "-1" means that the value is unallowed.
If the file is encoded with a variable bitrate, this value describes the average bitrate.

member.name: P:OpenAiTTS.Monotic.Multimedia.MP3.MP3Info.Padding

value.para: The padding in bytes

member.remarks: Padding is used to exactly fit the bitrate. As an example: 128kbps 44.1kHz layer II uses a lot of 418 bytes and some of 417 bytes long frames to get the exact 128k bitrate. For Layer I slot is 32 bits long, for Layer II and Layer III slot is 8 bits long.

value.para: A boolean value containing the private bit.

member.name: P:OpenAiTTS.Monotic.Multimedia.MP3.MP3Info.OriginalBit

value.para: A boolean value containing the original bit.

member.remarks: The original bit indicates, if it is set, that the frame is located on its original media.

member.name: P:OpenAiTTS.Monotic.Multimedia.MP3.MP3Info.Emphasis

value.para: An EmphasisEnum value describing the emphasis.

member.remarks: The emphasis indication is here to tell the decoder that the file must be de-emphasized, ie the decoder must "re-equalize" the sound after a Dolby-like noise supression. It is rarely used.

value.para: The length in seconds.

member.name: M:OpenAiTTS.Monotic.Multimedia.MP3.MP3Info.Update
member.summary: Writes all changes to the file.
